EU citizens will soon be able to use a non-Webkit browser engine on iOS. What? Yes! Yay for the open web. But there's a big but. The Cupertino giant isn't happy about it. How could you tell? entry.title: How to turn off password managers for fields (#snippet)
entry.summary:
Flavio shared how to tell 1Password not to interact with an input element. Ignoring the question of when you would want to turn off automatic password filling, how hard can it be to tell browsers and password managers not to mess with an input field? As Flavio shared, 1Password relies on data-1p-ignore. Fair enough. This attribute is oddly specific, though. How can you turn off auto-completion for LastPass users, then? That's right! Add data-lpignore="true" to your input field. But I'm a happy Dashlane user; how about this one? Dashlane created an entire spec called Semantically Annotated Web Forms to handle form completion. An easy data-form-type="other" will do it for this password manager. PW manager Turn off attribute
1Password data-1p-ignore
Lastpass data-lpignore="true"
Dashlâ€¦
